top_categories.workout_context: Race-pace efforts that mimic USA Cycling Gravel Nationals' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
USA Cycling Gravel Nationals' Champagne gravel, Blufftop climbs forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 131 miles.
At mile 60 of 131, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
53ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
7,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At USA Cycling Gravel Nationals, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of USA Cycling Gravel Nationals. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At USA Cycling Gravel Nationals, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 7,000ft of climbing on driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop does to your power file on race day.
7,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 131 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for USA Cycling Gravel Nationals’s 131 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at USA Cycling Gravel Nationals requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop climbs to build confidence. Expect: champagne gravel, blufftop climbs, rolling farm roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and Durability to prepare you for 131 miles of driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop climbs in La Crescent, Minnesota (2025-26); previously Gering, Nebraska (2023-24).
